task.title: Configuring Users
task.shortdesc: The includes several default users - one for each role. For increased security, you can customize the default users, delete them, or create additional Data Collector users.

context.p: userscreatingConfigure users in the properties file for the type of authentication that you use. For example, if you use basic authentication, use the basic-realm.properties file.
To hash login information, you can use an md5 program such as md5 on Mac OS X or md5sum on Linux.
For basic and form authentication, hash the password alone. For example: $ echo -n "<password>" | md5
For digest authentication, hash the combination of <user name>:<realm>:<password>, where <realm> is the authentication type.
For example, you might use the following command:$ echo -n "<user name>:<realm>:<password>" | md5

step.cmd: To configure a user, modify the properties file for the type of authentication that you use.
step.info: The file is located in the following directory: <SDCinstalldir>/etc/. When the is installed as a service, the file is located in the following directory: /etc/sdc/.
